benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails - Add account email

covered: POST Valid Payload: Multiple scenarios validate successful creation of an account email with valid payloads and required headers (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05).

POST Validation and Invalid Payload: Tests cover malformed JSON (TC10), missing required fields (TC11), invalid email format (TC12), missing/invalid accountId (TC07, TC08), and non-existent account (TC09).
Authorization / Access Control: Tests cover missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy header (TC13) and unauthorized access (TC14).
Large Payloads: Test for maximum field sizes (TC16).
Security: Tests guard against SQL injection (TC23) and XSS (TC24) attempts in email field.
Error/Resilience: Tests simulate external service unavailability (TC15), degraded database performance (TC19), and transient network failures (TC25).
Regression/Edge: Unicode input (TC21), backward compatibility (TC22), and documentation accessibility (TC27).
Integration/Consistency: TC26 verifies consistency by making email visible via subsequent GET and propagation to downstream systems.
gaps: Duplicate Submission: No dedicated test for handling duplicate email submissions (idempotency) within a single or burst of requests.
500 Internal Server Error: No explicit test simulates a 500 error from DB/API failures (only 503-type/service unavailability covered).
Rate Limiting: No tests verifying behavior under high request rate or throttling.
Caching/Observability: No tests addressing caching headers (e.g., ETag, Cache-Control) for POST responses where applicable.
Authorization edge cases: Expired or revoked tokens or token lifecycle edge cases are not explicitly covered.
recommendations: Add a dedicated test for duplicate submissions to ensure idempotent handling or clear error on duplicates.
Add a test simulating 500 Internal Server Error to validate server-side error handling and error payload.
Introduce rate-limiting/throttling tests to assess behavior under high load.
Add tests validating caching/observability headers where applicable and ensure proper error/documentation for such cases.
Extend authorization tests to cover token expiry/revocation scenarios and more exhaustive auth edge cases.
